299509.「失礼します！\n キリカ修道会の方が 来てくださいました！: Excuse me! The Kirika order is here!

299513.「はじめまして。\n キリカ修道会より まいりました\n 僧侶の サンと申します:
I'm San, a monk from the Order of Chiricahua.
My name is San, a priest from the Order of
Kirika.

299514.「あっ！ <pc>さん おひさしぶりです。\n また あなたに会えると 思ってい:
Ah! <pc> Long time no see! I was
hoping to see you again!

299515.「ガーディアンのお仕事……ぜひ\n 私にも お手伝いさせてくださいね。:
I would love to help you with your Guardian
work.

299516.「<pc>さんは サンさんとも\n お知り合いだったんですか？\n 団長ともそう:
So <pc> was also acquainted with San?
He was with the Commander as well, and he has
a very broad face!

299517.「うふふ。サンさんなんて 言いにくいでしょう？\n どうか サンと呼んでください:
Mmm-hmm. It's hard to say "Mr. San," isn't it?
Please, call me San, ladies and gentlemen.

299518.「では プリゼーラのことも\n プリゼーラと呼んでくださいね！ サン！: Then you can call Prisera Prisera too! San!

299519.「ところで あの……団長？\n お客さまに ご挨拶しなくていいのです……？:
By the way, um, Commander? Don't you have to
greet the guests...?

299522.<center><pipipi_low>孫には 父は死んだと 言い聞かせる！\n:
<pipipi_low>I will tell my grandson that his
father is dead! If he has a father like you,
it would be better for him to forget him!

299523.「……キリカ修道会のご協力 心から感謝します。\n 私は 守護騎士団の 団長を務:
I would like to thank the Order of Kirika for their cooperation. I am the head of the Guardians of the Order. I look forward to
working with you.

299524.「こちらこそ！ アストルティアを守る\n ガーディアンの活動に貢献できて 光栄で:
It's my pleasure! I am honored to contribute
to the Guardian's efforts to protect Astoltia.

299525.「さっそくですが 地獄の門というものを\n 見せていただいて よろしいですか？\:
May I take a quick look at the Gate of Hell? I
heard that the seal has been loosened...

299527.「セツラン君 <pc>君。\n 彼女の案内を お願いできますか？:
Mr. Setsuran <pc>. Could you please
show her around?

299529.「<pc>。オレは 先に行って\n 地獄の門の様子を 見てくるよ。:
<pc>. I'll go ahead and check out the
Gate of Hell.

299530.「<pc>は サンと一緒に\n 後から来て オレに話しかけてくれ。:
<pc> come back later with San and
talk to me.

299531.「お客さんを 地獄の門へ行かせるのに\n 団長が 同行しないなんて……？:
How can you send a guest to the Gate of Hell
and not have the Commander go with him?

299532.<cs_pchero>が 魔物を倒すと\nサンは 地獄の門の調査を 始めた……。:
After <cs_pchero> defeated the monster, San
began to investigate the Gate of Hell...

299533.「……おふたりは 地獄の門と呼ばれる\n この石像の正体を ご存知ですか？:
...Do you two know the identity of this stone
statue called the Gate of Hell?

299534.「くわしい話は 知らないなあ。\n １０００年前に 魔神族が残した\n 呪いの石:
I don't know the details of the story, though
I have heard that it is a cursed stone statue
left by a demon tribe a thousand years ago.

299535.「そう……アストルティアとは別の\n はるか遠き世界から召喚されし まつろわぬ神:
Yes...a god who is summoned from a world far,
far away from Astoltia. They are called the
Demon Gods...

299536.「今から １０００年ほど前\n この世界に ある魔神族が降り立ちました。\n 名:
About a thousand years ago, a race of demons
descended upon this world. His name is
Strezate.

299537.「その魔神族は アストルティアを気に入り\n 住みつくことにしました。しかし そ:
The demons loved Astoltia so much that they
decided to take up residence here. But it was
a nightmare for this world.

299538.「ストレザーテは アストルティアの各地に\n ふらりと現れては 人々を奴隷のよう:
Strezate would wander throughout Astoltia,
treating people like slaves and committing all
manner of tyranny.

299539.「かの魔神は その身に\n 無限の魔力を 有しており……歯向かう者は\n みな:
The demon god had unlimited magical power in
his body and all who defied him met a horrible
death.

299540.「魔神族のチカラは あまりに強大。\n それでも アストルティアを守るべく\n:
The power of the demonic gods was too great.
Even so, many brave warriors from around the
world rallied to protect Astoltia.

299541.「勇士たちは ウェナ諸島の荒地に\n ストレザーテを誘い出し 無限の魔力を有する:
The brave warriors lured the Strezate to the wastelands of the Wena Islands to fight against a visitor from another world with
unlimited magical power.

299542.「戦いは苛烈を極め 勇士たちの多くが\n 命を落としました。そして 彼らの正義の:
The battle was fierce and many of the brave warriors lost their lives. And in the face of their justice, the demigods were finally
defeated...

299543.「しかし 死の直前 ストレザーテは\n 大いなる呪いを 発動し\n 己が身を 巨:
But shortly before his death, Strezate invoked
a great curse and transformed himself into a
gigantic stone statue.

299544.「石像は 強力な魔物を 無数に生み出し\n それらは 世界中に散らばり 人々を\:
The statues created a myriad of powerful
monsters that scattered around the world,
condemning people to a screaming inferno.

299545.「しかし 呪いは あまりに強力で\n 石像を壊すことも かなわず\n 不完全な封:
But the curse was so powerful that it was
impossible to break the statue, and the best
they could do was to seal it imperfectly.

299546.「魔神族の化身たる石像は 地獄の門と名付けられ\n この地で 門の監視をになう:
The stone statues, incarnations of the demonic gods, were named the Gate of Hell, and the brave warriors who guarded the Gate were
called Guardians.

299547.「地獄の門が……魔神族の化身！？\n じゃあ 門から出てくる魔物も ストレザーテ:
The Gate of Hell... is an incarnation of the demon tribe? So the monsters that come out of the gates are made from the infinite magical
power of the Strezate?

299548.「そう 伝えられています。ストレザーテの\n 化身たる門が 無限の魔力を有する以:
So it is said. Since the gate, which is the incarnation of Stresate, possesses unlimited magical power, there is no choice but to
continue to seal it...

299549.「しかし 長い時の中で 地獄の門は\n 魔封のじゅずに対し 耐性を得たようですね:
But over time, the Gates of Hell seem to have
gained resistance to the Sealing Beads. Soon
the seal will be completely ineffective.

299550.「そんな！ もし 門が開きっぱなしになって\n 無限に 魔物が出てくるようになれ:
Oh, no! If the gates are left open and endless
monsters come out, this time Astoltia will be
destroyed!

299551.「それが……今なら\n なんとか できるかもしれません。:
That...we may be able to do something about it
now.

299552.「先ほど <cs_pchero>さんが倒した魔物……\n あれが 地獄の門から:
The monster that defeated earlier...the moment it came out of the Gate of Hell, the magic power of the Gate was
slightly reduced.

299553.「門の魔力が 減った？\n 無限の魔力を有しているはずじゃ……？:
The gate's magic power has decreased? It's
supposed to have unlimited magic...?

299554.「なので……私は こう推測します。\n ストレザーテの魔力は 無限と思えるほどに:
So...I guess this is what I think. Stresate's
magical power is so great that it seems
infinite, but it may be finite.

299555.「たとえば １０００年前に 門が有していた\n 魔力の量を 湖。魔物１匹を生み出:
For example, the amount of magical power the gate possessed a thousand years ago is a lake. Let's say the amount of magical power required
to create one monster is a glass of water.

299556.「門が開き 魔物を生み出すたびに 湖からは\n コップ１杯の水が 失われていき…:
Every time the gate opens and creates a
monster, the lake loses a cup of water... and
now there is only a bucket of water left.

299557.「なるほど……湖から コップ１杯の水をくんでも\n わからないけど バケツからく:
I see...so you can't tell if you're drinking a glass of water from a lake, but you can visibly see how much water you're losing
because you're drinking from a bucket.

299558.「そうです！ つまり これは……この地を守り\n 魔物を倒しつづけてきた ガーデ:
That's right! This is the result of a thousand
years of battle by the Guardians who have
protected this land and defeated monsters!

299559.「じゃあ 今なら 門の封印が解けても\n 出てくる魔物を 全部 倒してしまえば\:
So now, even if the gate is unsealed, if we defeat all the monsters that come out, we'll run out of magical power and the gate will
disappear?

299560.「いえ……それは難しいでしょう。バケツは例えで\n 地獄の門には まだ ウェナ諸:
No...that would be difficult. The bucket is an analogy, and the Gate of Hell still has enough magical power left to create a monster that
could cover the Wena Islands.

299561.「でも 今なら キリカ修道会に伝わる\n 秘術によって 地獄の門を この世から\:
But now, through the mystic arts handed down in the Order of Kirika, we may be able to erase the Gate of Hell from the world
altogether!

299562.「ですが 秘術には 準備が必要で……\n 少し 時間をくださいませんか？\n そ:
But the magic needs some preparation... so
could you give me some time? If you do that,
I'll...!

299563.「わかった！\n サンは 秘術の準備を 急いでくれ！:
Okay, okay, okay! San, get ready for the magic
trick. Hurry up!

299564.「とんでもないことになったよな……。\n いつ 門の封印が解けるか わからないし:
It's a hell of a mess we're in now... and we
don't know when the gates will be unsealed, so
we have to be more vigilant than ever.

299565.「オレは ここで 門の見張りを続ける。\n お前は サンが話してくれたことを\n:
I'll stay here and keep guarding the gate. You
go tell the Commander at headquarters what San
told you!
